options: Donâ€™t Equate Your Experiences to Theirs
Donâ€™t Strain Your Brain for Unnecessary Details

hints.Active Listening: Concentrate, understand, respond, and remember in a conversation.
hints.Reflective Statements: Mirror what the speaker has said, demonstrating understanding.
hints.Open-Ended Questions: Encourage elaboration by asking questions that can't be answered with a simple 'yes' or 'no'.
hints.Body Language: Use non-verbal cues to express interest and understanding.
hints.Emotional Awareness: Recognize, understand, and respect the feelings of others in a conversation.
hints.Empathy: Understand and share the feelings of others, validating their emotions.
hints.Assertiveness: Express your ideas confidently and respectfully, without undermining others.
hints.Summarizing: Restate key points to ensure everyone is on the same page.
hints.Providing Feedback: Give constructive responses, showing that you value their ideas.
hints.Focusing: Stay on topic to keep the conversation goal-oriented.
hints.Supply and Demand in Conversation: Balance the interest (demand) and discussion (supply) of a topic for conversational equilibrium.
hints.The Conversational Table: Ensure everyone in the conversation has equal opportunity to contribute.
hints.Clarifying: Ask questions or restate parts to ensure you understand correctly.
hints.Paraphrasing: Reword others' ideas, showing understanding and offering a chance for corrections.
hints.Don\u00e2\u20ac\u2122t Multitask: Give your full attention to the person and the conversation.
hints.Intellectual Humility: Admit when you donâ€™t know something; it opens the door for learning.
hints.Go with the Flow: Allow thoughts and responses to naturally evolve from the conversation.
hints.Don\u00e2\u20ac\u2122t Equate Your Exper: Respect the individuality of others' experiences.
hints.Don\u00e2\u20ac\u2122t Keep Repeating Yo: Make your point and allow the conversation to progress.
hints.Don\u00e2\u20ac\u2122t Strain Your Brain: Only mention details that contribute to the overall message or story.
hints.Forget About the Attention-Tricks: Genuine attention comes naturally from being truly engaged.
hints.Be Brief: Respect others' time and attention span by being concise yet comprehensive.
hints.Don\u00e2\u20ac\u2122t Pontificate: Approach conversations with a learning mindset, not an all-knowing attitude.
hints.Use Open-Ended Questions: Guide the conversation by allowing the other person to express their thoughts freely.
